translated: The Group of Three Collections🔽The Pot-born One
The Birth Story of the Ocean
“Who is this one who runs around
all around in the salty water,
and is harmed by the waves?”
is known in all directions as ‘the one who has crossed over.’
I wish to drink the ocean,

original: sāgaraṁ saritaṁ patiṁ”.🔽“So ayaṁ hāyati ceva,
analyzed: sāgaram saritam pati  saḥ ayam ha āyati ca iva
translated: the sea, the lord of the rivers.”🔽“This great ocean
It is not being drunk up,
the ocean is said to be undrinkable.”
The Birth Story of the Ocean, the sixth.
